intro: Ammannia dentifera, commonly known as the prairie bluestem, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and blue-green foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink to red in color, which bloom in late summer. Ammannia dentifera is often found in prairie habitats and can thrive in full sun with well-drained soil. It is also known for its ability to tolerate drought conditions and is sometimes used in native plant landscaping.
